version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> User interface symbols

emoji_net_data.name: repeat single button

bn:00099848a: In the same direction as the rotating hands of a clock
Of, or pertaining to a circular movement or rotation from left to right in the manner of a clock.

bn:00089731v: To say again something that someone else has already said by reproducing the words, inflections, etc.
To say, state, or perform again
To do or say again (and again).

bn:00024724n: An interval of space or time in which one set of events or phenomena is completed.
An interval during which a recurring sequence of events occurs
A series of changes or events ending where it began; a series of like events recurring in continuance; a cycle; a periodical revolution.
